summary: A detailed interview with Dr. Richard White, focusing on his background, role as Chief Editor at Scientific Reports, and his insights into scientific publishing.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated on a couch, speaking in front of a colorful geometric background. He begins by discussing his research background in chemistry, specifically in organic chemistry, and his interest in science. The man then elaborates on his experience in science, mentioning that he has not focused on a particular area but has been involved in various aspects of science. He shares his role as one of the launch editors of a publication and expresses his attraction to the idea of working with a team of scientists. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout, with the man's dialogue being the central focus.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing his research background in chemistry, mentioning a PhD and postdoctoral work in inorganic chemistry. He expresses a desire to move away from bench research and pursue a career that would broaden his perspective. He mentions joining Nature Communications as a launch editor and later moving to Scientific Reports, drawn to the idea of working on an inclusive and high-quality journal. The speaker generally speaks in a clear and professional tone. Throughout the speech there is soft background music playing that sounds inspirational, giving a sense of motivation and forward movement.

events_list.video_caption: The video features Dr. Richard White, the Chief Editor of Scientific Reports, seated in front of a colorful geometric background. He is wearing a light blue shirt and appears to be speaking, as indicated by his facial expressions and the presence of a microphone clipped to his shirt. The text overlay at the bottom of the screen reads, "There's no very typical day on Scientific Reports." As the video progresses, the text changes to "As Chief Editor, I oversee a group of eight," followed by "And we oversee the editorial decision making process" and "and the peer review process on the journal." The scene then transitions to a wider shot of an office environment, showing Dr. White seated at a desk with a computer monitor displaying a document titled "Editorial List." The office is bustling with activity, with other individuals working at their desks in the background. The video returns to Dr. White, who continues to speak, with the text overlay stating, "by our external Editorial Board Members." The final text reads, "So they are the people who decide whether to send a manuscript out to peer review." Throughout the video, the focus remains on Dr. White and his role in overseeing the editorial and peer review processes at Scientific Reports.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker stating that "there's no very typical day on scientific reports." He then describes his role as chief editor, overseeing a group of eight in-house editors. He explains how they oversee the editorial decision-making process and the peer review process on the journal. He mentions that these processes are managed directly by external editorial board members, who decide whether to send a manuscript out to peer review, recruit peer reviewers, and make decisions after peer review. The speaker maintains a professional and informative tone throughout.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker discussing project enhancements and improved time to decision. The speaker then mentions "scientific reports" and the varied and satisfying nature of the role. Throughout, his tone is professional and descriptive.

He describes the processes as "robust" in terms of "peer review" and "editorial process." He speaks in a thoughtful and explanatory tone. He mentions building a trusted, high-quality, and inclusive journal through developing those teams and the processes of the journal. Light and uplifting background music underscores the speech.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a light blue shirt is seated in front of a colorful geometric background, engaged in a conversation. He is identified as Dr. Richard White, the Chief Editor of Scientific Reports, as indicated by the text overlay on the screen. The conversation revolves around the editorial criteria of the journal, emphasizing that publication decisions are not based on perceived importance, significance, or impact. Instead, the rigorous peer review processes ensure that only high-quality research is published. The man appears to be speaking directly to the camera, with his facial expressions and gestures indicating his engagement in the discussion. The setting is professional, with a modern and vibrant backdrop that adds a dynamic visual element to the scene. The text overlays provide context to the conversation, highlighting the journal's commitment to quality and the peer review process.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features one male speaker discussing the scientific reports and publishing research from natural and clinical sciences. He notes that editorial decisions are not based on perceived importance but that rigorous peer review ensures only high-quality, robust science is published. The speaker's tone is informative and professional.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in front of a colorful geometric background, engaged in a discussion about the criteria for selecting papers for publication. He speaks about the importance of original contributions to existing knowledge, reproducible science, thorough reporting, and the contextual presentation of conclusions within previous literature. The man appears to be in a professional setting, possibly an office or studio, with a modern and vibrant design. The video transitions to a white screen with text asking, "What is the biggest misconception about Scientific Reports that you would like to dispel?" This question prompts viewers to consider common misunderstandings about the publication process. The overall atmosphere is informative and professional, aimed at educating the audience about the standards and values of scientific reporting.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single male speaker outlining criteria for evaluating papers, emphasizing originality, data-supported conclusions, reproducibility, and contextualization within previous literature, spoken in a calm and clear tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features Dr. Richard White, the Chief Editor of Scientific Reports, seated in a modern office setting with a colorful geometric background. He is wearing a light blue shirt and speaks about the inclusive nature of the journal, addressing misconceptions about inclusivity. The text on the screen provides context to his statements, such as "Because Scientific Reports is an inclusive journal," and "Of course, that isn't the case." The video transitions to a group of five people engaged in a discussion in a bright, contemporary office space, with one person holding a red cup and another using a laptop. The text on the screen reads, "We have rigorous, robust editorial and peer review processes," and "external Editorial Board Members." The video then returns to Dr. White, who continues to speak, emphasizing the importance of these processes. The final frame poses a question to the audience: "What advice would you give researchers planning to submit to Scientific Reports?" The video maintains a professional and informative tone throughout, with a focus on the editorial standards and inclusivity of the journal.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing "Scientific Reports" as an "inclusive journal," clarifying that this doesn't equate to publishing all submissions, mentioning a current acceptance rate of around 48%. He emphasizes the "rigorous and robust" editorial review process overseen by external editorial board members, which ensures only high-quality science is published.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a light blue shirt is seated on a couch, speaking directly to the camera. The background features a colorful geometric pattern with shades of green, yellow, and gray. Throughout the video, subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, providing context to his speech. The subtitles read: "To read our submission guidelines carefully and policies before submitting to the journal," "are fully supported by the data and the results that," "you may want to pay particular attention to titles," "your paper," "what the central conclusions of the paper are," "swiftly through the peer review process," and "clear, help to increase the impact of your paper." The man appears to be giving advice or instructions related to academic or professional writing, emphasizing the importance of adhering to submission guidelines, supporting claims with data, crafting effective titles, and ensuring clarity to enhance the impact of a paper. The setting is professional and visually engaging, with the colorful background adding a dynamic element to the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker providing advice to potential authors, emphasizing the need to carefully read submission guidelines and ensure compliance with relevant policies. His tone is measured and professional. The speaker then recommends ensuring the central conclusions are supported by the presented data, and paying particular attention to titles and abstracts. His tone becomes more emphatic as he highlights how titles and abstracts affect a paper's handling and review, and how they help increase its impact upon publication.
